Articles.Content:
As we all know, stock KSP is a canvas. A perfect blank square to which, when the perfect colors are added, we get a piece of art. 

I am wondering, what are peoples mod lists (colors) that they cannot play the game withought?

Cannot play the game without? Hmmm. That is getting harder to say with the recent releases, especially 1.0. For every new release I start a new career, and usually can get pretty far in the tech tree without any mods. But as soon as I want to go to Duna, its time to install KER and KAC. This has been the ritual since ~0.25 or so.

[Kerbal Engineer Redux](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/18230-1-0-Kerbal-Engineer-Redux-v1-0-16-2)

Gives you the best readouts you can get.

[Distant Object Enhancement](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/69907-0-24-Distant-Object-Enhancement-1-3-1-Planets-satellites-in-the-night-sky!-%287-29%29)

shows you distant planets on the nightsky, debris coasting around and makes the dark side of the moon blend in with the black of space.

[Kerbal Alarm Clock](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24786-1-0-Kerbal-Alarm-Clock-v3-3-0-1-%28Apr-28%29)

An Alarmclock for all events happening such as perfect timing for phase angles (interplanetary departure).

[Astronomers Visual Pack](http://kerbal.curseforge.com/ksp-mods/220335-astronomers-visual-pack-interstellar-v2)

CLOUDS! - make sure you pick[this one as a start](http://kerbal.curseforge.com/ksp-mods/220335-astronomers-visual-pack-interstellar-v2/files/2201704) as he goes insane on the memory with his other packs ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

[ScanSat](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/80369)

Mapping all the planets to have a map for biomes slopes and anomalies AND getting science in return.

[Chatterer](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92324-1-0-Chatterer-v-0-9-0-28-Apr-2015)

Radiochatter and more.

Some of them are outdated but have a link in the firstpost to the newest Thread.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-03T19:30:34Z" title="05/03/2015 07:30  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 3, 2015</time> by MalfunctionM1Ke**

The mods I would most hate to be without: KW Rocketry, Modular Rocket System (for parts), and for gameplay: KOS, Remote Tech, SCANSat, KER (not strictly neccesary but whoah it saves me some time), KAS (looking at KIS now). The gameplay mods I would REALLY hate to be without. Gonna give the new fairings and aerodynamics a good go but gonna get Procedural Fairings and FAR later and see how they feel compared to stock. With FAR, PF was just as essential as having an engine on the rocket.
I use kerbal engineer redux. It's pretty helpful, especially with phase angles. It'd be a lot harder to launch interplanetary missions without it, for me at least.

Remotech (com network with delay), KER (redux), Scansat (but gonna try stock scan for the moment).

May add KAS and KIS.

All these mods listed in my diary (<ith links,="" see="" sig=""></ith>

I ll make a game with RPM and ProbeRoom.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-04T09:11:32Z" title="05/04/2015 09:11  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 4, 2015</time> by brienne**

RO, plus TF/EI/DRE/TAC/RT2, that whole spiel. Also KIS, PF, Tantares/LV, OMSK, and Navhud.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-04T09:21:00Z" title="05/04/2015 09:21  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 4, 2015</time> by Kibble**

Toolbar, Chatterer, Contract Configurator + Packs, Crowd Sourced Science Logs, Enhanced NavBall, Kerbal Engineer, Kerbal Joint Reinforcements, Pilot Assistant, Stock Bug Fix Modules, TAC Life Support, Waypoint Manager, RealChute, RasterPropMonitor, Kerbal Alarm Clock

Aviation (Pre-0.1): B9 Aerospace, FAR, PAPIplugin, NavUtilities

Others: RemoteTech (makes it very difficult, sometimes too difficult for my taste)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-04T09:42:41Z" title="05/04/2015 09:42  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 4, 2015</time> by Andy81le**
